page.title: 12The Ecology of Himbleton
page.content: Over the past 10 years emphasis has been placed on cereal growing with farmers removing hedges and trees to accommodate larger farm machinery , also much of the land has been drained thus causing a loss of wildlife. In 1985 with a surplus of grain , steps are being taken to make everyone conservation minded. The enforcment of the new Wildlife & Countryside Act should help. Notable conservation work in the area is the clearence and replanting of Hornhill Wood,Earls Common which along with other sites has been designated as an area of "Special Scientific Interest"(S.S.I.). A great deal of work has been done on Bow Brook to reduce pollution. The Mill Pond at Shell Mill has been renovated and the trout and course fish that have been introduced are now breeding naturally.
